title: How is technology helping a small business? - Quora

response.answer_text: As a CPA who provides services to small businesses, here are the top 5 technology trends that I see impacting small businesses (in no particular order): Automation - This is a fairly wide-ranging item. This covers everything from automatic accounting transaction classification, to drone delivery, to kiosk (food) ordering and everything in between. The desire to automate tasks is further amplified by the continuing tightened labor market and wage inflation pressure. As qualified talent becomes harder to find, automation becomes an attractive option both for cost savings and quality control.YouTube: Automated transaction classification for business purposesYouTube: How To Automate Customer Scheduling, Add a Customer to Your Accounting Software, and Send An InvoiceForbes: Enterprise Bots And Automation Frees Up Employees - Now What?Cash - Overall, less physical cash is being used in our society. This year, for the first time, I prepared tax returns where the taxpayer was paying for items with crypto currency. Crypto currency is becoming more mainstream, sure, but services such as Venmo and Apple Pay are having an effect, too. More and more, customers are expecting businesses to allow them to pay however they want to pay.ZeroHedge: Retailers Rejecting Customers' Cash As More Ban Paper MoneyCloud - Applications and data storage have been moving to the cloud for at least a decade and will continue to do so for the foreseeable future. Internet connectivity speeds and the decreasing cost of data storage have allowed this to happen. The benefits of the cloud are many - increased automation, 24/7 data access, allowance for remote work and the like.YouTube: What is Cloud Accounting and why is it awesome?Quora: What are some advantages or disadvantages of a business being 100% cloud-based?Data - The quantity of data in our digital world is increasing at an exponential rate due to the number of apps collecting data, the number of connected devices collecting data and reductions in the cost to store data. Data is now informing content choices, “friend”/contact choices, marketing, the news we see, and everything in between. As an example, small business can micro-target just about anybody with ads on social media.World Economic Forum Blog: Data is the oil of the digital world.Analytics - As the quantity of data, speed of processing and data connectivity have all increased, advanced analytics capabilities have become more mainstream and more democratized. Based on what I’m seeing in my small business clients, data collection and analysis is migrating from a competitive advantage toward a ticket to get in the game.Blog: The Democratization of Analytics & Automation: The Cloud has Changed the LandscapeBottom line, technology is changing small business and will continue to do so. There are other areas than what I’ve identified above, as well as many sub-categories of what I’ve identified, but to me, these are the big 5. Hope this helps!

Small businesses have moved towards the technology trend of utilizing machine learning integrated data. It was common in the past for small businesses to rely on spreadsheet based reporting but now businesses have moved to integrating all of their data onto one unified platform. Small businesses that transition into data integration software, are able to organize their data and maximize insights about their business. My favorite machine learning data integration software is SimplData. SimplData was created to eliminate the need for spreadsheet based reporting and simplify data analysis so anyone can use it. It provides AI/BI technology where it will provide powerful insights to improve the business. It also has a lot of features to enhance customer experience and personalization. Some of the common data models it provides is: Factors Affecting Churn: where you can discover specific factors that may be causing customers to churn.Cluster Analysis: so you can distinguish customer segments and market to customers properly.Product Recommendation: so you can increase sales by targeting customers who are more likely to buy.Order Value Prediction: so you can keep track of how much your customers are buying and know individual spending habits.There are many more features SimplData provides, which you can check out on the website here. In the end, small businesses want to do what's best for their business. By eliminating spreadsheet based reporting, they’re one step closer to growing their business. I hope this helps!
